com.apriori.possible

Class Optional<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.possible.Optional<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the optional value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Possible<T>

    public abstract class Optional<T>
extends Object
implements Possible<T>
    A possible value that is immutable and cannot be null. An optional value is either some value or none.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.apriori.possible.Possible

        Possible.Visitor<T,R>

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public abstract <U> Optional<U> transform(Function<? super T,? extends U> function)
        Returns the current possible value, transformed by the specified function, if present.

        Overrides the return type to indicate that it will be an instance of Optional. If a value is present but the specified function returns null then no value is returned.

        Specified by:
        transform in interface Possible<T>
        Parameters:
        function - the function used to transform the value
        Returns:
        returns the current value, transformed by the specified function, if present; otherwise returns a possible value that is absent

      • filter

        public abstract Optional<T> filter(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        Filters the current value per the specified predicate. If a value is present and it matches the specified predicate then it is returned. Otherwise a possible value that is absent is returned.

        Overrides the return type to indicate that it will be an instance of Optional.

        Specified by:
        filter in interface Possible<T>
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicated used to test the value
        Returns:
        returns the current value if present and it matches the specified predicate; otherwise returns a possible value that is absent

      • or

        public abstract Optional<T> or(Possible<T> alternate)
        Returns the current possible value if present or the specified value if not.

        Overrides the return type to indicate that it will be an instance of Optional. If the specified possible value is not an Optional then it will be converted. In particular, if the specified value is present but null then no value is returned.

        Specified by:
        or in interface Possible<T>
        Parameters:
        alternate - an alternate value
        Returns:
        returns the current possible value if present or the alternate if not

      • or

        public abstract Optional<T> or(Optional<T> alternate)
        Returns the current value if one is present or the specified optional value if not.
        Parameters:
        alternate - an alternate value
        Returns:
        returns the current reference if a value is present or the alternate if not

      • none

        public static <T> Optional<T> none()
        Returns an object with no value present.
        Returns:
        an object with no value present

      • some

        public static <T> Optional<T> some(T t)
        Creates an object with the specified value. The value cannot be null.
        Parameters:
        t - the value
        Returns:
        an object with the specified value
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified value is null

      • of

        public static <T> Optional<T> of(T t)
        Creates an object that represents the specified value. If the value is not null then some value is returned, otherwise none.
        Parameters:
        t - the value
        Returns:
        some value with the specified value if not null, otherwise none

      • asOptional

        public static <T> Optional<T> asOptional(Possible<T> possible)
        Converts a possible value to an optional one. If the specified object is an optional value, it is returned. Otherwise, if the specified value is present and not null then some value is returned; if the specified value is absent or null then none.
        Parameters:
        possible - a possible value
        Returns:
        the possible value, converted to an optional one

      • cast

        public static <S,T> Optional<T> cast(Optional<S> from,
                                     Class<T> target)
        Casts an optional value to a different type. The present value must be assignable to the new type. Using this method is much more efficient than creating a new optional value with a different type. Since optional values are immutable, the type on an existing instance can safely be re-cast when a present value is an instance of the cast type.
        Parameters:
        from - the optional value from which we are casting
        target - the type to which the value will be cast
        Returns:
        this but re-cast to an Optional<T> where T is the target type
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the optional value is present and is not an instance of the specified type

      • upcast

        public static <S,T extends S> Optional<S> upcast(Optional<T> from)
        Upcasts an optional value to a super-type. This relies on the compiler to ensure that the types are compatible, so no class token argument is needed. Also, this version will never throw a ClassCastException.
        Parameters:
        from - the optional value from which we are casting
        Returns:
        this but re-cast to an Optional<S> where S is the super-type
        See Also:
        cast(Optional, Class)
